comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Seems to be Victoria Adelaide (1885-1970) and Charles Edward (1884-1954). The couple had five children; they were forced to abdicate from his "ducal throne" in 1918, after WWI. Charles, a grandson of Queen Victoria, later joined the Nazi Party and was head of the German Red Cross. They are maternal grandparents to the current King of Sweden. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Victoria_Adelaide_of_Schle... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Edward,_Duke_of_Saxe-Coburg...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Charles sided with Germany in WWI and was in the news in November 1914 because he narrowly escaped being killed by a shell that exploded near him, See NYT of November 25, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03E2DA1E3EE033A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Carl_Eduard_Sachsen_Coburg_und... is a 1905 picture of him. I think the photo here must date from about the same period, which is both when he became the Duke and when he and Victoria married.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks pennyrichardsca for providing the link to their individual stories, and thanks swanq, for finding the article describing the incident for which he may have been in the news.  I'll untangle the spelling of the name the next time we update the record.
